name: SAPA
mission: Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a not-for-profit, scientific professional, non-partisan, and humanitarian membership-based organization established in January 2019
theoryOfChange: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) has a documented strategic approach to its work. Their strategy is described as a "comprehensive, holistic approach to healthcare delivery" aimed at ensuring vulnerable groups, particularly women and children, receive accessible and quality healthcare. SAPA's overarching humanitarian goals include ensuring access to essential healthcare services, preventing and controlling communicable diseases, providing food assistance, supporting health facilities, strengthening local healthcare worker capacity, and fostering collaboration among humanitarian organizations. Their programming framework includes pillars such as Direct Health Service Delivery, Health System Resiliency, WASH, Food and Nutrition, and Protection, designed to increase disaster response capacity and build resilience. A Mid-2024 Report outlines a "framework for SAPA's programming moving forward" with an overarching goal for all targeted individuals to "survive and thrive" by 2026, benefiting from early nurturing, care, education, and reliable access to high-quality health and nutrition interventions. SAPA also implements a quality assurance framework that includes staff training, supervision, regular reporting, and partner-supported logistics. The organization's commitment to transparency regarding its goals, strategies, and achievements is further evidenced by its 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid.

evaluationSources: 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

score_details.score_summary: Sudanese American Physicians Association shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat/)

all_citations.claim: SAPA holds a 97.0/100 score with an 81.2% program expense ratio, $0.11 fundraising efficiency, and 4.3 months of working capital.
The organization provides specific donation options for zakat and other giving methods.
SAPA is zakat-eligible and maintains a zakat policy aligned with asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,502,228 and operates programs including healthcare, emergency services, and hunger relief.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall rating due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and direct impact on global health crises in high-urgency zones.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding working capital beyond 4.3 months to enhance long-term sustainability during protracted regional conflicts.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a zakat-eligible entity that addresses urgent global health needs [2][3]. Its mission to build resilient health systems in Sudan and Chad resonates with donors seeking to support high-urgency humanitarian causes [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAPA demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of healthcare and emergency services, supported by a total revenue of $3,502,228 and a program expense ratio of 81.2% [1][4]. Its financial health is robust, maintaining 4.3 months of working capital to sustain operations in volatile environments [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides life-saving emergency relief to communities in crisis across Sudan and Chad.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.2%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support healthcare and relief efforts.
Strong financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100.
Efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1.
baseline_narrative.summary: SAPA is a professional and humanitarian organization that builds core healthcare functions to respond to emergencies and hunger through direct medical services [1][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through programs that support vulnerable populations [2][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall rating due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and direct impact on global health crises in high-urgency zones.

areas_for_improvement.context: While SAPA tracks outcomes, it currently lacks <cite id="17">publicly available beneficiary counts</cite> necessary to calculate specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards with audited financials and independent board oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is mitigating these factors by maintaining high transparency and tracking 13 outcome metrics.
case_against.summary: Limited concerns primarily relate to the organization's <cite id="1">short operating history</cite> and data gaps regarding cost-effectiveness.

confidence.data_freshness: Data from 2023 Form 990 and 2024 Charity Navigator updates
confidence.notes: Strong alignment between financial filings and third-party ratings.

alignment.explanation: SAPA is a <cite id="7">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving <cite id="8">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite> like Sudan and Chad.
alignment.improvement: The organization could <cite id="18">expand services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage to maximize its alignment score.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAPA due to its <cite id="5">97.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite>, <cite id="9">Platinum Candid status</cite>, and <cite id="11">fully independent board of 12 members</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, SAPA could publish more detailed <cite id="17">annual impact reports</cite> that include specific beneficiary totals per program.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a <cite id="13">verified theory of change</cite> focused on direct medical provision.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="17">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for cost-effectiveness benchmarking.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Outcome tracking with verified theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides life-saving emergency relief to communities in crisis across Sudan and Chad.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support physician-led medical relief in high-conflict zones through a highly transparent, zakat-eligible organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through medical aid
Value high financial efficiency and low fundraising overhead
Care about the humanitarian crisis in Sudan and Chad
giving_considerations: Organization is in a high-growth phase with a short track record
Focus is on direct medical provision rather than long-term advocacy
High transparency helps mitigate risks of operating in conflict zones
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those who prefer organizations with decades of established history.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects a verified theory of change and tracking of 13 outcome metrics, though cost-per-beneficiary data is not yet public.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAPA builds core healthcare functions to ensure affected populations have access to essential medical services, reproductive care, and injury treatment.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical missions and hunger relief programs are reaching those in most desperate need effectively.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive scale of the humanitarian crisis in Sudan requires significantly more resources than currently available.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> compared to a <cite id="15">peer median of 85.2%</cite>.

similar_organizations.name: Khalil Center

strengths.detail: SAPA maintains a <cite id="5">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong governance and a <cite id="11">81.2% independent board</cite>.
The organization spends only <cite id="12">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are maximized for direct aid.
SAPA holds the <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and has a <cite id="13">documented theory of change</cite> for its humanitarian goals.

strengths_deep_dive: SAPA's operational strength is evidenced by its <cite id="14">4.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant resilience during regional instability. Their commitment to direct service is reflected in a <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> in their 2023 filings, significantly exceeding the <cite id="15">peer median of 85.2%</cite>. Furthermore, the organization has achieved <cite id="16">perfect scores of 100 in Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator, indicating a healthy and well-governed internal environment.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a professional humanitarian organization founded in <cite id="1">2019</cite> to strengthen healthcare systems and provide emergency relief in Sudan and Chad. SAPA has demonstrated remarkable growth, achieving a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>, with total revenue reaching <cite id="3">$3,502,228 in 2023</cite>. The organization operates with high financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 81.2%</cite> according to its latest tax filings, while Charity Navigator reports a <cite id="5">97/100 overall score</cite>. SAPA’s mission focuses on building core healthcare functions prepared to respond to crises, including <cite id="6">medical missions, hunger relief, and WASH programs</cite>. As a <cite id="7">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, SAPA provides a critical channel for Muslim donors to support medical interventions for the <cite id="8">poor and needy (fuqara and masakin)</cite> in conflict-affected regions. The organization is recognized for its transparency, holding a <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and tracking <cite id="10">13 distinct outcome metrics</cite> to ensure program effectiveness.
